alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:06PM EDT until July 15 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY... At 706 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Lake Ave in the 500 block has been closed due to flooding. Valley Street in the area of Belmont Street has been closed to due flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported and automated rain gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Manchester, Bedford, Londonderry and Auburn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 93 between mile markers 18 and 23. Interstate 293 between mile markers 1 and 7. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
